definition: to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He said it angrily, pointing at the notice on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他負氣地說着手指着牆上的告示。

sentences.english: His temper's been changeable this week, so don't annoy him.
sentences.chinese: 這禮拜他脾氣變幻無常，所以不要惹他負氣。

sentences.english: Sometimes I would be angry with him, but not for long.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾我會爲這些事跟父親負氣，但時刻都不會長。

sentences.english: They really know how to push my buttons.
sentences.chinese: 她們都知道怎麼惹我負氣。

sentences.english: To not gas, my bad hurts you, really sorry.
sentences.chinese: 別負氣，我的率性損傷了你，真的很抱歉。

sentences.english: The angry to hang up the phone, no reply.
sentences.chinese: 負氣的擅自掛斷了電話，沒有迴音。

sentences.english: From that you would get angry with your friends, we can conclude you still care about the friendship between you.
sentences.chinese: 如果朋儕讓你負氣，那說明你仍舊在乎他的友誼。

definition: lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
World Games/abbr. for 世界運動會|世界运动会[Shi4 jie4 Yun4 dong4 hui4]
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
